title: Ci Lyric in the Tang-Song Period
description:
The objective of the course is to introduce to students the evolution of ci lyric, the main features of ci aesthetics and criticism, the form and regulations of ci writing, as well as their relationships with popular and elite cultures. 



Major topics include: pre-Song anonymous popular lyrics found in Dunhuang and those written in the Song; major literati ci writers from Tang to Southern Song; lyrics sung in entertainment quarters and brothels; stylistic and thematic innovations in Northern Song; the distinction between the haofang (heroic and abandon) school and the wanyue (delicate and retrained) school; the evolution of ci criticism since the Five Dynasties.
prerequisite:
1) At least a B4 for GCE ‘O’ level Chinese or Higher Chinese; OR  
2) A pass in GCE ‘A’ level H1 Chinese or H2 Chinese; OR 
3) Equivalent qualifications may be accepted.
